skills.name: Multiply proper fractions in the form: Fraction × Integer
Multiply improper fractions in the form: Fraction × Integer
Multiply mixed number fractions in the form: Fraction × Integer

explanations.B: This is 3 and a half. We have 3 halves
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied the numerator and denominator by 3. 3/6 is the same as 1/2 which can't be the same as 3 halves.
explanations.D: I think you have just multiplied the denominator by 3. Remember we have 3 halves here.

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied the numerator and denominator by 5. 5/20 is the same as 1/4 which can't be the same as 5 quarters.
explanations.B: I think you have just multiplied the denominator by 5. Remember we have 5 quarters here.
explanations.C: We have 5 quarters which is written as 5/4
explanations.D: This is 5 and a quarter. We have 5 quarters

explanations.A: I think you have added the numerators here. We have 3 lots of 5 halves. How many halves would we have?
explanations.B: This is 5 and a half, but we have 3 lots of 5 halves. How many halves is that?
explanations.C: We have 3 lots of 5 halves. This is 15 halves.
explanations.D: I think you have multiplied the numerator and denominator by 3. This is giving us an answer that is equivalent to 5/2. We have 3 lots of 5 halves. How many halves is that?

explanations.A: We have 5 lots of 3 halves. This is 15 halves.
explanations.B: I think you have multiplied the numerator and denominator by 5. This is giving us an answer that is equivalent to 3/2. We have 5 lots of 3 halves. How many halves is that?
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied the denominator by 5. We have 5 lots of 3 halves. How many halves is that?
explanations.D: This is 5 and 3 halves. We have 5 lots of 3 halves. How many halves is that?

explanations.A: We would use the a to help work out the numerator, but it wouldn't tell us about the denominator.
explanations.B: When we multiply a fraction by an integer we multiply the numerator and the integer, and the denominator stays the same. This means the denominator will stay as b
explanations.C: We would use the c to help work out the numerator, but it wouldn't tell us about the denominator.
explanations.D: We would use the c to help work out the numerator, but it wouldn't tell us about the denominator.

explanations.A: We would use the r to help work out the numerator, but it wouldn't tell us about the denominator.
explanations.B: We would use the r to help work out the numerator, but it wouldn't tell us about the denominator.
explanations.C: We would use the p to help work out the numerator, but it wouldn't tell us about the denominator.
explanations.D: When we multiply a fraction by an integer we multiply the numerator and the integer, and the denominator stays the same. This means the denominator will stay as q

explanations.A: We have 2 lots of 1 = 2 and 2 lots of a quarter = 2/4 = 1/2. In total we have 2 and a half
explanations.B: I think you made a mistake when multiplying the quarter by 2 and you doubled the denominator. 2 quarters is not 1/8.
explanations.C: I think you made a mistake when multiplying the quarter by 2, I think you doubled the numerator and denominator. 2 quarters is not 2/8.
explanations.D: I think you remembered to multiply the 1 by 2, but I think you forgot to multiply the quarter by 2

explanations.A: I think you made a mistake when multiplying the half by 3, I think you multiplied the numerator and denominator. 3 halves is not 3/6.
explanations.B: I think you remembered to multiply the 1 by 3, but I think you forgot to multiply the half by 3.
explanations.C: 3 lots of 1 is 3. 3 lots of a half is 3/2 = 1 and a half. In total we have 3 + 1 and a half = 4 and a half.
explanations.D: I think you forgot to multiply the 1 by 3, and when you multiplied the half by 3 you multiplied the denominator by mistake. We have 3 lots of 1 and 3 halves.

explanations.A: When we multiply something by 1 it stays the same.
explanations.B: I think you added 1 to each of the numbers in the fraction. We needed to multiply by 1. What is 1 lot of 3 and 2 fifths?
explanations.C: I think you added 1. We needed to multiply by 1. What is 1 lot of 3 and 2 fifths?
explanations.D: I think you added 1 fifth. We needed to multiply by 1. What is 1 lot of 3 and 2 fifths?

explanations.A: I think you added 1. We needed to multiply by 1. What is 1 lot of 1 and 2 sevenths?
explanations.B: I think you added 1 seventh. We needed to multiply by 1. What is 1 lot of 1 and 2 sevenths.
explanations.C: When we multiply any number by 1 it stays the same.
explanations.D: I think you added 1 to each of the numbers in the fraction. We needed to multiply by 1. What is 1 lot of 1 and 2 sevenths?
